markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 17"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Voyager's Pack](/Equipment.aspx?ID=469)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 617 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 14,800 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn backpack

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This leather rucksack has icons burned into it, and every time it’s taken to a plane it hasn’t been to before, a new icon representing that plane scorches into the surface. The pack grants you a +3 bonus to Survival checks. It also enables you to see the magical traces of creatures’ passage, allowing you to Track a creature that has teleported. The GM sets the DC of this check, usually using the level and DC of the teleportation spell. This lets you find the location of the creature’s destination, and you can use that destination when casting [_teleport_](/Spells.aspx?ID=338) or activating the pack, even though you don’t know what it looks like.

 The pack contains an extradimensional space with the same properties as a [_type II bag of holding_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=249). This space contains the contents of a climber’s kit. If any components of that kit are removed and not returned, they return to the pack at dawn each day.

<document level="2" id="action-281" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Voyager's Pack

The GM sets the DC of this check, usually using the level and DC of the teleportation spell. This lets you find the location of the creature’s destination, and you can use that destination when casting teleport or activating the pack, even though you don’t know what it looks like.
